Detailed Description

template<class Dimensions, class Precision = DefaultPrecision>
struct PhysicalModeling::DimensionedQuantities::Quantity< Dimensions, Precision >

Template class to define a data type with appropriate dimensions.

This is the most common element to directly use from this file: it allows you to declare a variable that has some dimensional meaning (mass, length, etc) and optionally some numerical precision (defaults to DefaultPrecision.) The documentation for the dimensioned quantities module contains some examples and details.

Template Parameters:
Dimensions One of the dimension typedefs from this file.
Precision (Optional) The value type to store, defaults to PhysicalModeling::DimensionedQuantities::DefaultPrecision

Quantity ( Quantity< OtherDimensions, Precision > const &  rhs  )  [inline]

Conversion constructor, to handle results of multiplication and division.

Compile-time assert included to handle dimensions safely: See http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_43_0/libs/mpl/doc/tutorial/implementing.html for why this conversion and assert is needed.

Definition at line 297 of file DimensionedQuantities.h.

Quantity<Dimensions, Precision> operator+= ( const Quantity< Dimensions, Precision > &  r  )  [inline]

Accumulation (+=) operator for quantities with dimensions.

Prevents accumulation of quantities with incompatible dimensions, and allows accumulation of quantities with equal dimensions.

Definition at line 307 of file DimensionedQuantities.h.

Quantity<Dimensions, Precision> operator-= ( const Quantity< Dimensions, Precision > &  r  )  [inline]

Negative accumulation (-=) operator for quantities with dimensions.

Prevents accumulation of quantities with incompatible dimensions, and allows accumulation of quantities with equal dimensions.
